meanings.definition: To carry someone on one's back.
meanings.sent1: I piggybacked my little sister to the park.
meanings.sent2: The firefighter piggybacked the injured man to safety.
meanings.sent3: The piggyback ride to the ice cream shop was a fun adventure.
meanings.sent4: Her laughter piggybacked on the wind, filling the air with joy.
meanings.sent5: The image of the piggybacked child clinging to his father's shoulders stayed with her forever.

meanings.definition: To be carried on someone's back.
meanings.sent1: The tired toddler piggybacked on his father's shoulders.
meanings.sent2: The injured hiker piggybacked on the guide to reach the campsite.
meanings.sent3: The idea of a backpack piggybacking on a backpack seemed silly.
meanings.sent4: Her hopes and dreams piggybacked on the success of her business.
meanings.sent5: The memories of childhood piggybacked on her mind, bringing back nostalgic feelings.

meanings.definition: To be attached to something larger or more important.
meanings.sent1: The new module piggybacks onto the existing software.
meanings.sent2: The small satellite piggybacks on the main rocket for launch.
meanings.sent3: The tiny fish piggybacked on the back of the giant sea turtle.
meanings.sent4: His ambition piggybacked on the success of his mentor.
meanings.sent5: The rumor piggybacked on the truth, spreading like wildfire through the town.
